treatment.description: Cells curved or crooked slender rods, moderately long to filamentous, 0.3-0.5 µm wide. Gram positive. Nonmotile. Cells produce fimbriae. Strictly anaerobic. Fastest growth between 55˚C and 65˚C. Energy metabolism by the reduction of CO2 to CH4, with H2 as the electron donor. Formate is also used as a substrate for methanogenesis. Acetate is not required as a growth factor. Capable of growth between pH 7-8. Sulfur is reduced to sulfide. Ammonia is the sole nitrogen source, and sulfide may serve as the sulfur source. Habitat: anaerobic sewage sludge digestors. The mol% G+C is 62.2.
